recordTypes.name: Water Will-Serve
recordTypes.description: For development projects, an applicant is required to submit a Will-Serve Application to Public Works regarding their anticipated water demand and sewer generation rate.

recordTypes.name: Temporary Water Meters
recordTypes.description: For construction and Capital Improvement projects, an applicant may need temporary water service (recycled and/or potable).

recordTypes.name: Code Enforcement
recordTypes.description: Report a Code Compliance Violation

recordTypes.name: Design Permit
recordTypes.description: A Design Permit ensures excellence in site planning, architectural design, and consistency with the general plan. A design permit allows for new development or changes in permitted uses in the perspective zoning district.

recordTypes.name: Conditional Use Permit
recordTypes.description: As determined by the specific zoning district, some uses require a Conditional Use Permit (CUP). The CUP application requires public notice and is approved by the Planning Commission through a Public Hearing. Applicants interested in Minor Use Permits and Temporary Conditional Use Permits should also use this application.

recordTypes.name: Oversize/Overweight Transportation Permit
recordTypes.description: For oversize/overweight loads coming into or through the City of American Canyon.

recordTypes.name: Residential Express Building Permit
recordTypes.description: This is for small, non-structural projects that don't require formal construction plans or a lengthy plan review, allowing for same-day or quick issuance. Examples include like-for-like replacements for re-roofing,  water heater, electrical work, window replacement and HVAC.

recordTypes.name: Preliminary Application
recordTypes.description: A Preliminary Application (Pre-App) is a great way to solicit information from City Staff regarding a proposed project. The Pre-App can include an informational meeting with multiple City Departments for preliminary direction on a project. No formal action is taken.

recordTypes.name: Major Modification
recordTypes.description: The purpose of the Major Modification is to provide for major modifications to previously approved plans or permits, based on the degree of change from an approved plan or permit. A Major Modification requires public notice and is approved by the Planning Commission through a public hearing.

recordTypes.name: Fire District Permit
recordTypes.description: Fire Sprinkler, Fire Alarm and

recordTypes.name: Minor Modification
recordTypes.description: The purpose of the Minor Modification is to provide for minor modifications to previously approved plans or permits, based on the degree of change from a previously approved plan or permit. A Minor Modification is approved administratively by the Community Development Director.

recordTypes.name: Grading Permit
recordTypes.description: For certain development projects, an applicant is required to submit a Grading Permit Application to Public Works.

recordTypes.name: Address Assignment Request
recordTypes.description: Use this form to request the assignment of an address to your project. Note that addresses will only be assigned when new development or alteration work is proposed.

recordTypes.name: Appeal Form
recordTypes.description: Select this application to make an appeal to decisions made by the Community Development Director or the Planning Commission.

recordTypes.name: Conditional Fence Permit
recordTypes.description: A Conditional Fence Permit allows a maximum 2½-foot increase over the Zoning Ordinance fence height regulations in residential zoning districts.

recordTypes.name: General Plan / Specific Plan / Zoning Ordinance / Zoning Map Amendment
recordTypes.description: This application allows an applicant to propose a General Plan, Specific Plan, Zoning Ordinance, or Zoning Map amendment.  A preliminary application is highly recommended before beginning this application.

recordTypes.name: Landscape Plan
recordTypes.description: The Landscape Plan is a planting and irrigation plan for a project site. "Landscape area" means all the planting areas, turf areas, and water features in a landscape design plan, subject to the maximum applied water allowance calculation.

recordTypes.name: Lot Line Adjustment / Lot Merger
recordTypes.description: A Lot Merger is required when two or more parcels of real property may be merged by the Planning Commission when specific conditions are met. A Lot Line Adjustment (LLA) is a transfer of land between two or more existing adjacent parcels, where the land taken from one parcel is added to an adjacent parcel, and where a greater number of parcels than originally existed is not thereby created.

recordTypes.name: Pre-Zoning / Rezoning
recordTypes.description: The pre-zoning/ rezoning application is required for the development of a new zone or to make amendments to an existing zone.

recordTypes.name: Seasonal Sales Permit
recordTypes.description: A seasonal sales permit is required for outdoor sales of seasonal agricultural products.

recordTypes.name: Sign Permit / Program
recordTypes.description: A sign permit or sign program is required for new or modified signs in the City.

recordTypes.name: Temporary Mobile Structure Permit
recordTypes.description: A Temporary Trailer Permit (TTP) is required prior to placing any temporary trailer on private property.

recordTypes.name: Temporary Outdoor Promotion
recordTypes.description: A Temporary Outdoor Promotion (TOP) Permit is for an outdoor commercial event of limited duration, such as grand openings, outdoor sales, and seasonal promotions, occurring on nonresidential, private property.

recordTypes.name: Tentative Parcel/ Subdivision Map
recordTypes.description: A Tentative Parcel Map is filed for the division into four (4) or fewer residential lots or non-residential subdivisions. A Tentative Subdivision Map is filed for the division into five (5) or more lots.

recordTypes.name: Variance / Minor Variation
recordTypes.description: Variances may be granted in order to prevent or to lessen practical difficulties and unnecessary physical hardships that would result from strict or literal interpretation and enforcement of certain regulations of Zoning Code.

recordTypes.name: Zoning Verification Letter
recordTypes.description: Staff can provide a zoning verification letter for inquiries into a property’s zoning and development standards.

categories.name: Fire District
categories.content:
The American Canyon Fire Protection District issues fire permits as part of our commitment to public safety, property protection, and compliance with the California Fire Code (CFC). Under the CFC, a “permit” grants permission to maintain, store, use, or handle materials, or to conduct processes — that could pose a fire or life-safety hazard, or to install or modify fire protection systems.

Permits are required to ensure that any activity, construct
